subject: Re: [junit] Testing a void method....
msgSnippet: ... I have never on any project ever tested whether close() closes a database connection. By a show of hands, how many people have tested that? -- J. B. (Joe)
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
>
> On 8/27/06, Chris Barham <cbarham@...
> <mailto:cbarham%40pobox.com>> wrote:
> >
> > On 8/26/06, Truong, David <david_truong@...
> <mailto:david_truong%40bmc.com>> wrote:
> >
> > >I have a question about testing a void method that it main purpose is to
> > >close a connection.
> >
> > pass it a mock connection which has an expectation of a call on to the
> > close
> > method.
>
> The danger with this approach is that if you upgrade your JDBC driver and
> that in the new version, close() is broken, your test will keep passing but
> your application will break...

I have never on any project ever tested whether close() closes a
database connection. By a show of hands, how many people have tested that?
